GraphicElements

Class Bouncer

  • java.lang.Object
    • GraphicElements.Bouncer

  • public class Bouncer
extends java.lang.Object
    Object that defines a graphical node (circle) and the animation and conditions required for create the illusion of constant movement and predictable bouncing in collision with other objects This object represents graphically an Individual for this project IMPORTANT: A Bouncer IS NOT an Individual, but the graphical representation created with the parameters of one These two concepts are related in the following way: 1. An Individual is generated by setting the values of the attributes defined in the Individual class 2. Those values are used to create an instance of this class 3. This Bouncer will participate in a simulation and based on its performance it will receive a fitness value 4. Once the Bouncer receive its fitness value it will set that value to the Individual from which it was created

      private void calculateFitnessValue()
      In order to assign a fitness value to a bouncer two conditions are checked: 1.
      private void computeClosestDistance()
      To compute if the bouncer is in its closest position yet it compares the current distance to the center of the target zone against its previous closest distance, if it is smaller then updates that attribute and recalculate the fitness value of this bouncer
      double getFitnessValue()
      The fitness value obtained by the previous function may exceed 1 or be less than 0, for some cents This function normalizes that value and return it

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bouncer

        public Bouncer(javafx.geometry.Point2D position,
               double radius,
               Maze maze,
               double currentDirection,
               double velocity,
               long initialDelay)
        Create a new bouncer with the given data
        Parameters:
        position - point indicating the initial X and Y points where the center of the circle will be located Relative to the bouncingArea
        radius - radius of the node of this bouncer
        maze - a reference to an object Maze, must contain the proper references to the bouncingArea and obstacles objects
        currentDirection - the initial direction in radians this bouncer must begin
        velocity - the amount of pixels this bouncer should move every time it moves
        initialDelay - the amount in seconds this bouncer will wait until it begins its simulation

    • Method Detail

      • getNode

        public javafx.scene.shape.Circle getNode()

      • getInitialDelay

        public long getInitialDelay()

      • computeClosestDistance

        private void computeClosestDistance()
        To compute if the bouncer is in its closest position yet it compares the current distance to the center of the target zone against its previous closest distance, if it is smaller then updates that attribute and recalculate the fitness value of this bouncer

      • calculateFitnessValue

        private void calculateFitnessValue()
        In order to assign a fitness value to a bouncer two conditions are checked: 1. Its distance to the target zone 2. The amount of obstacles that are in between the node and the target zone The closest the distance to the target zone, the higher the fitness value, but it lose some points if it still had to pass some obstacle when its closest distance was calculated

      • getFitnessValue

        public double getFitnessValue()
        The fitness value obtained by the previous function may exceed 1 or be less than 0, for some cents This function normalizes that value and return it
        Returns:
        a number between 0 and 1 representing to the performance of this bouncer

      • move

        private void move()
        Whenever this node is asked to move it changes its center by the amounts indicated by stepX and stepY

      • play

        public void play()

      • stop

        public void stop()

      • updateDirection

        private void updateDirection(double newDirection)
        When a collide is detected the current course is updated according to the angle received. The stepX and stepY units are updated too. They represent the velocity (pixels per frame) the bouncer must move and the direction. May be negative. The stepY particularly have to be negated because the Y-axis is upside-down
        Parameters:
        newDirection - a new direction in radians
